posts.name: Dylan Matthew Haueter
posts.cooked: Hello. Our Robotics Team here at GKHS High School have a problem. I am getting this error repeatedly and I have no clue on how to fix it. The error itself is: Unresolved dependency: com.revrobotics:CANSparkMax:1.5.1Java(0). The GKHS Software Team is very new to the whole programming thing, and if we could get this fixed, hopefully we can have a moving robot. Thank you.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: CANSparkMax is the old way of calling SparkMax controllers. Change it to SparkMax instead ! It will be super helpful if you make your code available on github when posting these types of things as well.

posts.name: Dylan Matthew Haueter
posts.cooked: Hello and thank you for seeing this. Unfortunately, this did not work. This is the new error: Unresolved dependency: com.revrobotics:SparkMax:1.5.1Java(0). My question, is there anything that I needed to install beforehand? Like any .jar or .pom files?

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
403210:

SparkMax

It looks like you may not have added your vendordep for this.

From your top menu bar select “View” Select Command Pallete Input in Manage Vendor dependencies input this url in the field that comes up : https://software-metadata.revrobotics.com/REVLib-2025.json hit enter

posts.name: Dylan Matthew Haueter
posts.cooked: I followed your instruction, and when I got there, there was no search bar.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
Theres an even easier way now read the instructions and then select Rev Robotics in the list of available options!

Teams that are using non- PWM motor controllers or advanced sensors will most likely need to install external vendor dependencies. What Are Vendor Dependencies?: A vendor dependency is a way for ve...

link_counts.title: 3rd Party Libraries — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: I think you either copied a robot program from several years ago that manually defined the spark-max dependency in build.gradle or else you used a several year old vendordep and manually changed the year. You need to purge the references to the old library and use the 2025 vendordep.

posts.name: Dylan Matthew Haueter
posts.cooked: Hello, sorry for late response. I’ve got all the vendordeps and got the revrobotics. It got rid of problems in gradle, but I still have a few errors in my TankDrive that I hope to get sorted out at the comp.
